name: Lost for Words! 17 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"I've been through the desert on a horse with no ______ 
It felt good to be out of the rain" 

So what is the horse missing?
questions.explanation:
name.

	The group America had a hit with these lyrics from the song "Horse With No Name" in 1971 / 1972. Written by lead singer Dewey Bunnell it was a US chart topper, reaching #3 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Well she touched my hand what a chill I got 
Her lips are like a ______ when it's hot 
I'm proud to say that she's my buttercup 
I'm in love 
I'm all shook up"

What word describes those hot lips?
questions.explanation:
volcano.

	"All Shook Up" was a hit for Elvis Presley in 1957. This US and UK chart topper was written by Elvis and Otis Blackwell.

questions.text:
"Don't go breaking my heart
I couldn't if I tried
______ if I get restless
Baby you're not that kind"

How did Elton John address his partner in this song?
questions.explanation:
Honey.

	Elton John dueted with Kiki Dee on these lyrics from "Don't Go Breaking My Heart".This 1976 song was a chart topper on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text:
"What would you do if I sang out of tune 
would you ______ up and walk out on me"

What word completes this well-known song lyric?
questions.explanation:
stand.

	"A Little Help From My Friends" featured on the Beatles album "Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band".This track was written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney and sung by Ringo Starr.

questions.text:
"There is a ______ in New Orleans 
They call the Rising Sun 
And it's been the ruin of many a poor boy 
And God I know I'm one"

Which of these was the Rising Sun?
questions.explanation:
house.

	The Animals, fronted by Eric Burdon, hit with "House Of The Rising Sun" in 1964.The song topped both the US and UK charts.

questions.text:
"Only the lonely
____-____-____-______ doo-wah
Know the way I feel tonight 
Ooh yay, yay, yay, yeah

A famous lyric, but which word is missing?
questions.explanation:
Dum-dum-dum-dumdy.

	These lyrics come from the Roy Orbison classic "Only The Lonely".Written by Roy Orbison and Joe Melson this 1960 track topped both the US and UK charts.

questions.text:
"Here I am, Prayin' for this moment to last
Livin' on the music so fine, Borne on the wind
Makin' it mine, ______ fever, ______ fever"

What fever caused this epidemic in the 1970s?
questions.explanation:
night.

	"Night Fever" hit for The Bee Gees in 1978.The three brothers, Barry, Robin and Maurice Gibb, topped the US and UK charts with this song.

questions.text:
"We didn't start the ______ 
It was always burning 
Since the world's been turning"

What is the singer disclaiming responsibility for starting?
questions.explanation:
fire.

	These lyrics come from singer / songwriter Billy Joel's song "We Didn't Start The Fire".A US chart topper it peaked at #7 in the UK in 1989.

questions.text:
"When you're close to me, I can feel your heart beat 
I can hear you breathing near my ear 
Wouldn't you agree, baby you and me got a ______ kind of love"

What word describes this love?
questions.explanation:
groovy.

	"A Groovy Kind Of Love" was a hit for Phil Collins in 1988.This US and UK #1 chart single featured on the soundtrack of the movie "Buster".The Mindbenders originally had a UK hit with "A Groovy Kind Of Love" in 1966.

questions.text:
And finally what is the missing route number?

"If you ever plan to motor west 
Travel my way, the highway that's the best 
Get your kicks on Route ______"
questions.explanation:
66.

	These lyrics are from the classic Chuck Berry track."(Get Your Kicks On) Route 66", written by B. Troupe, has also been recorded by The Rolling Stones, Van Morrison and Nat King Cole.
